trans-unit.source: Provides control capability to render a command that the user can select to dial the specified phone number.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
For devices with telephony capability, such as a cell phone, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PhoneCall> control renders a command that the user can select to dial the specified phone number.

On devices without telephony capability, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PhoneCall> control renders alternate text, possibly including the phone number or a link; it is not treated as a command that has dialing capability.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PhoneCall"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Adds, to the list provided, the set of forms that contains links to the specified control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The set of forms that contain links to the specified control.
Gets or sets a formatting string for the text value that is displayed on devices that are not able to originate telephone calls.

The default value is `{0} {1}`, meaning that the default text will be the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text"></xref> property with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PhoneCall.PhoneNumber"></xref> property concatenated to it, with a space between them.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An example of the default string is, Call `{0}` at `{1}` right now!!

where the system replaces `{0}` with the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PhoneCall> object (the `innerText` of the element on the page), and `{1}` with the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PhoneCall.PhoneNumber%2A> property.
A formatting string for the text value that is displayed on devices that are not able to originate telephone calls.
Gets or sets the URL where the device will go to on non-calling devices.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

What the user sees is controlled by the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PhoneCall> object, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PhoneCall.PhoneNumber%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PhoneCall.AlternateFormat%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PhoneCall.AlternateUrl%2A> properties.
This property is only used on devices that are unable to originate telephone calls as an alternative location for navigation purposes.
The URL where the device will go to on non-calling devices.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.PreRender"></xref> event.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method notifies the server control to perform any necessary prerendering steps prior to saving view state and rendering content.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> object that contains the event data.
the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PhoneCall.PhoneNumber"></xref> property is empty.
Gets or sets a string that represents a phone number.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PhoneCall.PhoneNumber%2A> property is required on <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PhoneCall> controls.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PhoneCall.PhoneNumber%2A> property accepts strings in a variety of formats.
The format for the following types of numbers is described by using the Backus-Naur Format (BNF syntax is a way to describe the syntax of file formats):
A phone number can consist of an optional country or region code, prefixed with a + sign, followed by any sequence of numbers that makes up the phone number.
The characters marked as `decoration_character` can appear anywhere in the phone number and are ignored.
For `i-Mode` phones, the following rules currently apply when specifying a phone number:
The string must begin with "0" or "#".
If the string begins with "0", the numbers are more than nine digits.
If the string begins with "#", the numbers are more than three digits.
The numbers can contain "(", ")" and "-" in the string.
The string must be fewer than 24 characters.
The following list shows some examples of valid phone numbers:
A string that represents a phone number.
the format of the number is invalid.
Notifies the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PhoneCall"></xref> object of a postback event.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents an optional event argument to be passed to the event handler.
Gets or sets the label used when a softkey is displayed.
The default value is the word `Call` (or a localized equivalent).
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This property is used only for devices that support softkeys.
The label used when a softkey is displayed.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler.RaisePostBackEvent(System.String)"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PhoneCall> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler> interface.
The optional event arguments to be passed to the event handler.
